newsitem.title: USA: U.S. issues first Hanukkah postage stamp.
newsitem.headline: U.S. issues first Hanukkah postage stamp.

text.p: The U.S. Postal Service on Tuesday issued the first U.S. stamp marking the Jewish holiday of Hanukkah.
The 32-cent stamp, issued jointly with Israel, features a menorah, the candle-holder that is the centrepiece of the eight-day holiday beginning this year on the evening of Dec. 5.
An Israeli stamp with the same design was issued on Tuesday in Jerusalem by the Israel Postal Authority.
The Hanukkah stamp was the first issued by the U.S. Postal Service for a religious holiday other than Christmas. U.S. stamps with Christmas designs have been sold since 1962.

"Let the candles of Hanukkah brighten our hearts as they brighten America's cards and letters this holiday season," Postmaster General Marvin Runyon said at the dedication ceremony for the stamp at Adas Israel Congregation in Washington.
"This stamp is a contribution to cementing the special relations between the United States and Israel," Israel's Ambassador to the United States, Eliahu Ben-Elissar, said.
